thread.title: Shortcomings led to WA cyclone tragedy
thread.title_full: Shortcomings led to WA cyclone tragedy

title: Shortcomings led to WA cyclone tragedy
text:
Thu, Aug 27, 2015, 2:55 PM AEST - Australia Markets close in 1 hr 5 mins Shortcomings led to WA cyclone tragedy AAP – 17 minutes ago Print 
A West Australian coroner has pointed out shortcomings in how building surveyors assess wind regions after a cyclone smashed through a rail construction camp in the Pilbara, killing two workers. 
Kitchenhand Debra Till, 47, and excavator operator Craig Raabe, 42, died in March 2007 after Tropical Cyclone George crashed through transportable accommodation units that housed workers for the Fortescue Metals Group project. 
"There is still no readily accessible method by which a local government authority or building surveyor may ascertain the smoothed coastline, from which the measurement is to be taken to ascertain the correct wind region," coroner Ros Fogliani said in findings handed down on Thursday. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Walmart to stop selling AR-15s guns AAP
